content: squaring the spiral dishcloth the spiral has been one of my favorite motifs since long before i understood how to form one in crochet and what better to wash dishes with than something that makes you smile just to look at it i hope this dishcloth brings a lightness of heart to your dishwashing the way it does to mine enjoy materials approximately 1 5 ounces of worsted weight cotton about 75 ounce of each color and a size h 5 00 mm crochet hook tapestry needle for weaving ends abbreviations u s notation chain chain stitch double_crochet…double_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch notes this pattern is worked in a spiral do not join rounds each round is worked half in one color and half in the other so that there are two live stitches at all times and they are opposite each other at the end of the round be sure to pull up a big enough loop when you drop one color that you don t lose stitches while you re working with the other color you can secure your live stitch further by knotting your loop or fastening a large safety pin or similar item through it so that it can t be pulled through the stitch starting with round 7 the first squaring round all increases are worked as chain-2s at the corners so the rest of the round is worked even that is each stitch is worked into the next stitch as you proceed around finished size approximately 7 5 inches 19 cm square the pattern with color a chain 4 join with slip_stitch to form ring round 1 chain 2 3 half_double_crochet in ring drop color a
